text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak says U.S. aid to Egypt was not and would not be a means of pressure on Egypt. In an interview with the daily Al-Ahram and its weekly sister Al-Ahram Al-Arabi, Mubarak says it is unfair to practise pressures on Palestinian President Yasser Arafat alone.
- Mubarak sends Pakistni President Farooq Khan Leghari a message on the occasion of Pakistan's independence day.
- Prime Minister Kamal Ganzouri will chair a cabinet meeting on Wednesday to discuss the phenomenon of thuggery.
- U.S. assistant state secretary, Frank Wisner, arrived in Cairo for talks on developments of the peace process.
